63enum class LinkMismatchError
64{
65 // Shared
66 NO_MISMATCH,
67 TYPE_MISMATCH,
68 ARRAY_SIZE_MISMATCH,
69 PRECISION_MISMATCH,
70 STRUCT_NAME_MISMATCH,
71 FIELD_NUMBER_MISMATCH,
72 FIELD_NAME_MISMATCH,
73
74 // Varying specific
75 INTERPOLATION_TYPE_MISMATCH,
76 INVARIANCE_MISMATCH,
77
78 // Uniform specific
79 BINDING_MISMATCH,
80 LOCATION_MISMATCH,
81 OFFSET_MISMATCH,
82 INSTANCE_NAME_MISMATCH,
83 FORMAT_MISMATCH,
84
85 // Interface block specific
86 LAYOUT_QUALIFIER_MISMATCH,
87 MATRIX_PACKING_MISMATCH,
88};
89
90void LogLinkMismatch(InfoLog &infoLog,
91 const std::string &variableName,
92 const char *variableType,
93 LinkMismatchError linkError,
94 const std::string &mismatchedStructOrBlockFieldName,
95 ShaderType shaderType1,
96 ShaderType shaderType2);

98bool IsActiveInterfaceBlock(const sh::InterfaceBlock &interfaceBlock);

101void LoadBlockMemberInfo(BinaryInputStream *stream, sh::BlockMemberInfo *var);

103void WriteShaderVar(BinaryOutputStream *stream, const sh::ShaderVariable &var);
104void LoadShaderVar(BinaryInputStream *stream, sh::ShaderVariable *var);
105
106// Struct used for correlating uniforms/elements of uniform arrays to handles
107struct VariableLocation
108{
109 static constexpr unsigned int kUnused = GL_INVALID_INDEX;
110
111 VariableLocation();
112 VariableLocation(unsigned int arrayIndex, unsigned int index);
113
114 // If used is false, it means this location is only used to fill an empty space in an array,
115 // and there is no corresponding uniform variable for this location. It can also mean the
116 // uniform was optimized out by the implementation.
117 bool used() const { return (index != kUnused); }
118 void markUnused() { index = kUnused; }
119 void markIgnored() { ignored = true; }
120
121 bool operator==(const VariableLocation &other) const
122 {
123 return arrayIndex == other.arrayIndex && index == other.index;
124 }
125
126 // "arrayIndex" stores the index of the innermost GLSL array. It's zero for non-arrays.
127 unsigned int arrayIndex;
128 // "index" is an index of the variable. The variable contains the indices for other than the
129 // innermost GLSL arrays.
130 unsigned int index;
131
132 // If this location was bound to an unreferenced uniform. Setting data on this uniform is a
133 // no-op.
134 bool ignored;
135};
136
137// Information about a variable binding.
138// Currently used by CHROMIUM_path_rendering
139struct BindingInfo
140{
141 // The type of binding, for example GL_FLOAT_VEC3.
142 // This can be GL_NONE if the variable is optimized away.
143 GLenum type;
144
145 // This is the name of the variable in
146 // the translated shader program. Note that
147 // this can be empty in the case where the
148 // variable has been optimized away.
149 std::string name;
150
151 // True if the binding is valid, otherwise false.
152 bool valid;
153};
154
155struct ProgramBinding
156{
157 ProgramBinding() : location(GL_INVALID_INDEX), aliased(false) {}
158 ProgramBinding(GLuint index) : location(index), aliased(false) {}
159
160 GLuint location;
161 // Whether another binding was set that may potentially alias this.
162 bool aliased;
163};
164
165class ProgramBindings final : angle::NonCopyable
166{
167 public:
168 ProgramBindings();
169 ~ProgramBindings();
170
171 void bindLocation(GLuint index, const std::string &name);
172 int getBindingByName(const std::string &name) const;
173 int getBinding(const sh::ShaderVariable &variable) const;
174
175 using const_iterator = angle::HashMap<std::string, GLuint>::const_iterator;
176 const_iterator begin() const;
177 const_iterator end() const;
178
179 private:
180 angle::HashMap<std::string, GLuint> mBindings;
181};
182
183// Uniforms and Fragment Outputs require special treatment due to array notation (e.g., "[0]")
184class ProgramAliasedBindings final : angle::NonCopyable
185{
186 public:
187 ProgramAliasedBindings();
188 ~ProgramAliasedBindings();
189
190 void bindLocation(GLuint index, const std::string &name);
191 int getBindingByName(const std::string &name) const;
192 int getBindingByLocation(GLuint location) const;
193 int getBinding(const sh::ShaderVariable &variable) const;
194
195 using const_iterator = std::unordered_map<std::string, ProgramBinding>::const_iterator;
196 const_iterator begin() const;
197 const_iterator end() const;
198
199 private:
200 std::unordered_map<std::string, ProgramBinding> mBindings;
201};

203class ProgramState final : angle::NonCopyable
204{
205 public:
206 ProgramState();
207 ~ProgramState();
208
209 const std::string &getLabel();
210
211 Shader *getAttachedShader(ShaderType shaderType) const;
212 const gl::ShaderMap<Shader *> &getAttachedShaders() const { return mAttachedShaders; }
213 const std::vector<std::string> &getTransformFeedbackVaryingNames() const
214 {
215 return mTransformFeedbackVaryingNames;
216 }
217 GLint getTransformFeedbackBufferMode() const
218 {
219 return mExecutable->getTransformFeedbackBufferMode();
220 }
221 GLuint getUniformBlockBinding(GLuint uniformBlockIndex) const
222 {
223 return mExecutable->getUniformBlockBinding(uniformBlockIndex);
224 }
225 GLuint getShaderStorageBlockBinding(GLuint blockIndex) const
226 {
227 return mExecutable->getShaderStorageBlockBinding(blockIndex);
228 }
229 const UniformBlockBindingMask &getActiveUniformBlockBindingsMask() const
230 {
231 return mActiveUniformBlockBindings;
232 }
233 const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> &getProgramInputs() const
234 {
235 return mExecutable->getProgramInputs();
236 }
237 DrawBufferMask getActiveOutputVariables() const { return mActiveOutputVariables; }

239 {
240 return mExecutable->getOutputVariables();
241 }

243 {
244 return mExecutable->getOutputLocations();
245 }

247 {
248 return mSecondaryOutputLocations;
249 }

264 }
265 const std::vector<ImageBinding> &getImageBindings() const
266 {
267 return getExecutable().getImageBindings();
268 }
269 const sh::WorkGroupSize &getComputeShaderLocalSize() const { return mComputeShaderLocalSize; }
270 const RangeUI &getDefaultUniformRange() const { return mExecutable->getDefaultUniformRange(); }
271 const RangeUI &getSamplerUniformRange() const { return mExecutable->getSamplerUniformRange(); }
272 const RangeUI &getImageUniformRange() const { return mExecutable->getImageUniformRange(); }
273 const RangeUI &getAtomicCounterUniformRange() const { return mAtomicCounterUniformRange; }
274
275 const std::vector<TransformFeedbackVarying> &getLinkedTransformFeedbackVaryings() const
276 {
277 return mExecutable->getLinkedTransformFeedbackVaryings();
278 }
279 void setLinkedTransformFeedbackVaryings(
280 const std::vector<TransformFeedbackVarying> _mLinkedTransformFeedbackVaryings) const
281 {
282 return mExecutable->setLinkedTransformFeedbackVaryings(_mLinkedTransformFeedbackVaryings);
283 }
284 const std::vector<GLsizei> &getTransformFeedbackStrides() const
285 {
286 return mExecutable->getTransformFeedbackStrides();
287 }
288 const std::vector<AtomicCounterBuffer> &getAtomicCounterBuffers() const
289 {
290 return mExecutable->getAtomicCounterBuffers();
291 }
292
293 GLuint getUniformIndexFromName(const std::string &name) const;
294 GLuint getUniformIndexFromLocation(UniformLocation location) const;
295 Optional<GLuint> getSamplerIndex(UniformLocation location) const;
296 bool isSamplerUniformIndex(GLuint index) const;
297 GLuint getSamplerIndexFromUniformIndex(GLuint uniformIndex) const;
298 GLuint getUniformIndexFromSamplerIndex(GLuint samplerIndex) const;
299 bool isImageUniformIndex(GLuint index) const;
300 GLuint getImageIndexFromUniformIndex(GLuint uniformIndex) const;
301 GLuint getAttributeLocation(const std::string &name) const;
302
303 GLuint getBufferVariableIndexFromName(const std::string &name) const;
304
305 int getNumViews() const { return mNumViews; }
306 bool usesMultiview() const { return mNumViews != -1; }
307
308 bool hasAttachedShader() const;
309
310 ShaderType getFirstAttachedShaderStageType() const;
311 ShaderType getLastAttachedShaderStageType() const;
312
313 const ProgramAliasedBindings &getUniformLocationBindings() const
314 {
315 return mUniformLocationBindings;
316 }
317
318 const ProgramExecutable &getExecutable() const
319 {
320 ASSERT(mExecutable);
321 return *mExecutable;
322 }
323 ProgramExecutable &getExecutable()
324 {
325 ASSERT(mExecutable);
326 return *mExecutable;
327 }
328
329 bool hasImages() const { return !getImageBindings().empty(); }
330 bool hasEarlyFragmentTestsOptimization() const { return mEarlyFramentTestsOptimization; }
331
332 bool isShaderMarkedForDetach(gl::ShaderType shaderType) const
333 {
334 return mAttachedShadersMarkedForDetach[shaderType];
335 }
336
337 // A Program can only either be graphics or compute, but never both, so it
338 // can answer isCompute() based on which shaders it has.
339 bool isCompute() const { return mExecutable->hasLinkedShaderStage(ShaderType::Compute); }
340
341 const std::string &getLabel() const { return mLabel; }
342 const ShaderMap<bool> &getAttachedShadersMarkedForDetach() const
343 {
344 return mAttachedShadersMarkedForDetach;
345 }
346
347 uint32_t getLocationsUsedForXfbExtension() const { return mLocationsUsedForXfbExtension; }
348
349 const std::vector<GLenum> &getOutputVariableTypes() const { return mOutputVariableTypes; }
350
351 ComponentTypeMask getDrawBufferTypeMask() const { return mDrawBufferTypeMask; }
352
353 bool hasBinaryRetrieveableHint() const { return mBinaryRetrieveableHint; }
354
355 bool isSeparable() const { return mSeparable; }
356
357 PrimitiveMode getGeometryShaderInputPrimitiveType() const
358 {
359 return mGeometryShaderInputPrimitiveType;
360 }
361
362 PrimitiveMode getGeometryShaderOutputPrimitiveType() const
363 {
364 return mGeometryShaderOutputPrimitiveType;
365 }
366
367 int getGeometryShaderInvocations() const { return mGeometryShaderInvocations; }
368
369 int getGeometryShaderMaxVertices() const { return mGeometryShaderMaxVertices; }
370
371 int getDrawIDLocation() const { return mDrawIDLocation; }
372
373 int getBaseVertexLocation() const { return mBaseVertexLocation; }
374
375 int getBaseInstanceLocation() const { return mBaseInstanceLocation; }
376
377 private:
378 friend class MemoryProgramCache;
379 friend class Program;

381 void updateTransformFeedbackStrides();
382 void updateActiveSamplers();
383 void updateProgramInterfaceInputs();
384 void updateProgramInterfaceOutputs();

386 // Scans the sampler bindings for type conflicts with sampler 'textureUnitIndex'.
387 void setSamplerUniformTextureTypeAndFormat(size_t textureUnitIndex);
388
389 std::string mLabel;
390
391 sh::WorkGroupSize mComputeShaderLocalSize;
392
393 ShaderMap<Shader *> mAttachedShaders;
394 ShaderMap<bool> mAttachedShadersMarkedForDetach;
395
396 uint32_t mLocationsUsedForXfbExtension;
397 std::vector<std::string> mTransformFeedbackVaryingNames;
398
399 // For faster iteration on the blocks currently being bound.
400 UniformBlockBindingMask mActiveUniformBlockBindings;
401
402 std::vector<VariableLocation> mUniformLocations;
403 std::vector<BufferVariable> mBufferVariables;
404 RangeUI mAtomicCounterUniformRange;
405
406 // EXT_blend_func_extended secondary outputs (ones with index 1) in ESSL 3.00 shaders.
407 std::vector<VariableLocation> mSecondaryOutputLocations;
408
409 DrawBufferMask mActiveOutputVariables;
410
411 // Fragment output variable base types: FLOAT, INT, or UINT. Ordered by location.
412 std::vector<GLenum> mOutputVariableTypes;
413 ComponentTypeMask mDrawBufferTypeMask;
414
415 bool mBinaryRetrieveableHint;
416 bool mSeparable;
417 bool mEarlyFramentTestsOptimization;
418
419 // ANGLE_multiview.
420 int mNumViews;
421
422 // GL_EXT_geometry_shader.
423 PrimitiveMode mGeometryShaderInputPrimitiveType;
424 PrimitiveMode mGeometryShaderOutputPrimitiveType;
425 int mGeometryShaderInvocations;
426 int mGeometryShaderMaxVertices;
427
428 // GL_ANGLE_multi_draw
429 int mDrawIDLocation;
430
431 // GL_ANGLE_base_vertex_base_instance
432 int mBaseVertexLocation;
433 int mBaseInstanceLocation;
434 // Cached value of base vertex and base instance
435 // need to reset them to zero if using non base vertex or base instance draw calls.
436 GLint mCachedBaseVertex;
437 GLuint mCachedBaseInstance;
438
439 // Note that this has nothing to do with binding layout qualifiers that can be set for some
440 // uniforms in GLES3.1+. It is used to pre-set the location of uniforms.
441 ProgramAliasedBindings mUniformLocationBindings;
442
443 std::shared_ptr<ProgramExecutable> mExecutable;
444};
445
446struct ProgramVaryingRef
447{
448 const sh::ShaderVariable *get(ShaderType stage) const
449 {
450 ASSERT(stage == frontShaderStage || stage == backShaderStage);
451 const sh::ShaderVariable *ref = stage == frontShaderStage ? frontShader : backShader;
452 ASSERT(ref);
453 return ref;
454 }
455
456 const sh::ShaderVariable *frontShader = nullptr;
457 const sh::ShaderVariable *backShader = nullptr;
458 ShaderType frontShaderStage = ShaderType::InvalidEnum;
459 ShaderType backShaderStage = ShaderType::InvalidEnum;
460};
461
462using ProgramMergedVaryings = std::vector<ProgramVaryingRef>;

464class Program final : public LabeledObject, public angle::Subject
465{
466 public:

476 {
477 ASSERT(!mLinkingState);
478 return mProgram;
479 }

495 const ProgramExecutable &executable,
496 const ProgramMergedVaryings &mergedVaryings);
497
498 // KHR_parallel_shader_compile
499 // Try to link the program asynchrously. As a result, background threads may be launched to
500 // execute the linking tasks concurrently.
501 angle::Result link(const Context *context);
502
503 // Peek whether there is any running linking tasks.
504 bool isLinking() const;
505
506 bool isLinked() const
507 {
508 ASSERT(!mLinkingState);
509 return mLinked;
510 }

704
705 ANGLE_INLINE void addRef()
706 {
707 ASSERT(!mLinkingState);
708 mRefCount++;
709 }
710
711 ANGLE_INLINE void release(const Context *context)
712 {
713 ASSERT(!mLinkingState);
714 mRefCount--;
715
716 if (mRefCount == 0 && mDeleteStatus)
717 {
718 deleteSelf(context);
719 }
720 }
721
722 unsigned int getRefCount() const;
723 bool isInUse() const { return getRefCount() != 0; }
724 void flagForDeletion();
725 bool isFlaggedForDeletion() const;
726
727 void validate(const Caps &caps);
728 bool validateSamplers(InfoLog *infoLog, const Caps &caps)
729 {
730 // Skip cache if we're using an infolog, so we get the full error.
731 // Also skip the cache if the sample mapping has changed, or if we haven't ever validated.
732 if (infoLog == nullptr && mCachedValidateSamplersResult.valid())
733 {
734 return mCachedValidateSamplersResult.value();
735 }
736
737 return validateSamplersImpl(infoLog, caps);
738 }
739
740 bool isValidated() const;
741
742 Optional<bool> getCachedValidateSamplersResult() { return mCachedValidateSamplersResult; }
743 void setCachedValidateSamplersResult(bool result) { mCachedValidateSamplersResult = result; }
744
745 const std::vector<ImageBinding> &getImageBindings() const
746 {
747 ASSERT(!mLinkingState);
748 return getExecutable().getImageBindings();
749 }
750 const sh::WorkGroupSize &getComputeShaderLocalSize() const;
751 PrimitiveMode getGeometryShaderInputPrimitiveType() const;
752 PrimitiveMode getGeometryShaderOutputPrimitiveType() const;
753 GLint getGeometryShaderInvocations() const;
754 GLint getGeometryShaderMaxVertices() const;
755
756 const ProgramState &getState() const
757 {
758 ASSERT(!mLinkingState);
759 return mState;
760 }

763 const sh::ShaderVariable &variable1,
764 const sh::ShaderVariable &variable2,
765 bool validatePrecision,
766 bool validateArraySize,
767 std::string *mismatchedStructOrBlockMemberName);

770 GLuint getOutputResourceIndex(const GLchar *name) const;

772 void getOutputResourceName(GLuint index, GLsizei bufSize, GLsizei *length, GLchar *name) const;

775 GLsizei bufSize,
776 GLsizei *length,

795 int getNumViews() const
796 {
797 ASSERT(!mLinkingState);
798 return mState.getNumViews();
799 }

801 bool usesMultiview() const { return mState.usesMultiview(); }

803 ComponentTypeMask getDrawBufferTypeMask() const;

805 const std::vector<GLsizei> &getTransformFeedbackStrides() const;
806
807 // Program dirty bits.
808 enum DirtyBitType
809 {
810 DIRTY_BIT_UNIFORM_BLOCK_BINDING_0,
811 DIRTY_BIT_UNIFORM_BLOCK_BINDING_MAX =
812 DIRTY_BIT_UNIFORM_BLOCK_BINDING_0 + IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_COMBINED_SHADER_UNIFORM_BUFFERS,
813
814 DIRTY_BIT_COUNT = DIRTY_BIT_UNIFORM_BLOCK_BINDING_MAX,
815 };
816
817 using DirtyBits = angle::BitSet<DIRTY_BIT_COUNT>;
818
819 angle::Result syncState(const Context *context);
820
821 // Try to resolve linking. Inlined to make sure its overhead is as low as possible.
822 void resolveLink(const Context *context)
823 {
824 if (mLinkingState)
825 {
826 resolveLinkImpl(context);
827 }
828 }
829
830 ANGLE_INLINE bool hasAnyDirtyBit() const { return mDirtyBits.any(); }
831
832 // Writes a program's binary to the output memory buffer.
833 angle::Result serialize(const Context *context, angle::MemoryBuffer *binaryOut) const;
834
835 rx::Serial serial() const { return mSerial; }
836
837 const ProgramExecutable &getExecutable() const { return mState.getExecutable(); }
838 ProgramExecutable &getExecutable() { return mState.getExecutable(); }
839
840 const char *validateDrawStates(const State &state, const gl::Extensions &extensions) const;
841

843 std::vector<const sh::ShaderVariable *> *filteredVaryingsOut);

845 ShaderType outputShaderType,
846 ShaderType inputShaderType,
847 const sh::ShaderVariable &input,
848 const sh::ShaderVariable &output,
849 bool validateGeometryShaderInputs,
850 bool isSeparable,
851 gl::InfoLog &infoLog);

860 InfoLog &infoLog);

862 const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> &fragmentVaryings,
863 int vertexShaderVersion,
864 InfoLog &infoLog);

930 // Both these function update the cached uniform values and return a modified "count"
931 // so that the uniform update doesn't overflow the uniform.

934 GLsizei count,

969 void resolveLinkImpl(const gl::Context *context);

971 void postResolveLink(const gl::Context *context);

973 rx::Serial mSerial;
974 ProgramState mState;
975 rx::ProgramImpl *mProgram;
976
977 bool mValidated;
978
979 ProgramBindings mAttributeBindings;
980
981 // EXT_blend_func_extended
982 ProgramAliasedBindings mFragmentOutputLocations;
983 ProgramAliasedBindings mFragmentOutputIndexes;

985 bool mLinked;
986 std::unique_ptr<LinkingState> mLinkingState;
987 bool mDeleteStatus; // Flag to indicate that the program can be deleted when no longer in use
988
989 unsigned int mRefCount;

991 ShaderProgramManager *mResourceManager;
992 const ShaderProgramID mHandle;

994 // Cache for sampler validation
995 Optional<bool> mCachedValidateSamplersResult;

997 DirtyBits mDirtyBits;
